Description: Painted plaster cast of a relief on the exterior north wall of the Hypostyle Hall at Karnak, showing Seti I trampling the Libyans. Section A – six columns of painted hieroglyphic text.
Curator's comments: The cast is composed of 15 pieces (EA91083a-o), which are joined to form 9 sections. The cast is part of the Hay Cast Collection, created by Robert Hay (1799-1863) during his travels to Egypt from 1824-28 and 1829-34. It was amongst the ‘Moulds of various sculptures from the Walls of the Great Temple Karnak’ listed on page 5 of a list of casts belonging to Hay which were deposited at the BM in 1842. Published in: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, p. 152
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs, unlocking Ancient Egypt.
Condition: Good, seperated from whole, chips and flakes on edges
